chunk:
), a loader (Gelsenicine), and main (Gelsevirine) plug-ins written using the Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC) framework. [Gelsemium](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0666) has been used by the Gelsemium group since at least 2014.(Citation: ESET Gelsemium June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: DanBot
Software description: [DanBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1014) is a first-stage remote access Trojan written in C# that has been used by [HEXANE](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1001) since at least 2018.(Citation: SecureWorks August 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PowerShower
Software description: [PowerShower](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0441) is a PowerShell backdoor used by [Inception](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0100) for initial reconnaissance and to download and execute second stage payloads.(Citation: Unit 42 Inception November 2018)(Citation: Kaspersky Cloud Atlas August 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: MacSpy
Software description: [MacSpy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0282) is a malware-as-a-service offered on the darkweb  (Citation: objsee mac malware 2017).
Platforms: macOS

Software name: Micropsia
Software description: [Micropsia](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0339) is a remote access tool written in Delphi.(Citation: Talos Micropsia June 2017)(Citation: Radware Micropsia July 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Stuxnet
Software description: [Stuxnet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0603) was the first publicly reported piece of malware to specifically target industrial control systems devices. [Stuxnet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0603) is a large and complex piece of malware that utilized multiple different behaviors including multiple zero-day vulnerabilities, a sophisticated Windows rootkit, and network infection routines.(Citation: Nicolas Falliere, Liam O Murchu, Eric Chien February 2011)(Citation: CISA ICS Advisory ICSA-10-272-01)(Citation: ESET Stuxnet Under the Microscope)(Citation: Langer Stuxnet) [Stuxnet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0603) was discovered in 2010, with some components being used as early as November 2008.(Citation: Nicolas Falliere, Liam O Murchu, Eric Chien February 2011) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ROKRAT
Software description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) is a cloud-based remote access tool (RAT) used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067) to target victims in South Korea. [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067) has used ROKRAT during several campaigns from 2016 through 2021.(Citation: Talos ROKRAT)(Citation: Talos Group123)(Citation: Volexity InkySquid RokRAT August 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CSPY Downloader
Software description: [CSPY Downloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0527) is a tool designed to evade analysis and download additional payloads used by [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094).(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RotaJakiro
Software description: [RotaJakiro](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1078) is a 64-bit Linux backdoor used by [APT32](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0050). First seen in 2018, it uses a plugin architecture to extend capabilities. [RotaJakiro](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1078) can determine it's permission level and execute according to access type (`root` or `user`).(Citation: RotaJakiro 2021 netlab360 analysis)(Citation: netlab360 rotajakiro vs oceanlotus)
Platforms: Linux

Software name: IcedID
Software description: [IcedID](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0483) is a modular banking malware designed to steal financial information that has been observed in the wild since at least 2017.  [IcedID](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0483)  has been downloaded by [Emotet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0367) in multiple campaigns.(Citation: IBM IcedID November 2017)(Citation: Juniper IcedID June 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: NETWIRE
Software description: [NETWIRE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0198) is a publicly available, multiplatform remote administration tool (RAT) that has been used by criminal and APT groups since at least 2012.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Sept 2017)(Citation: McAfee Netwire Mar 2015)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Webinar Sept 2017)
Platforms: Windows, Linux, macOS

Software name: LitePower
Software description: [LitePower](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0680) is a downloader and second stage malware that has been used by [WIRTE](https://

entities.description: DanBot is a first-stage remote access Trojan written in C# that has been used by HEXANE since at least 2018.

entities.name: CSPY DOWNLOADER
entities.description: CSPY Downloader is a tool designed to evade analysis and download additional payloads used by Kimsuky.

entities.description: RotaJakiro is a 64-bit Linux backdoor used by APT32, first seen in 2018.

entities.description: APT37 is a group that has used ROKRAT during several campaigns from 2016 through 2021.

entities.name: KIMSUKY
entities.description: Kimsuky is a group that uses CSPY Downloader to evade analysis and download additional payloads.

entities.name: APT32
entities.description: APT32 is a group that uses RotaJakiro, a Linux backdoor, for cyber operations.

entities.name: APT33
entities.description: APT33 is a group that has used NETWIRE for remote administration tasks since at least 2012.

chunk:
PT groups since at least 2012.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Sept 2017)(Citation: McAfee Netwire Mar 2015)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Webinar Sept 2017)
Platforms: Windows, Linux, macOS

Software name: LitePower
Software description: [LitePower](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0680) is a downloader and second stage malware that has been used by [WIRTE](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0090) since at least 2021.(Citation: Kaspersky WIRTE November 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Chaes
Software description: [Chaes](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0631) is a multistage information stealer written in several programming languages that collects login credentials, credit card numbers, and other financial information. [Chaes](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0631) was first observed in 2020, and appears to primarily target victims in Brazil as well as other e-commerce customers in Latin America.(Citation: Cybereason Chaes Nov 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TrickBot
Software description: [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266) is a Trojan spyware program written in C++ that first emerged in September 2016 as a possible successor to [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024). [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266) was developed and initially used by [Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102) for targeting banking sites in North America, Australia, and throughout Europe; it has since been used against all sectors worldwide as part of "big game hunting" ransomware campaigns.(Citation: S2 Grupo TrickBot June 2017)(Citation: Fidelis TrickBot Oct 2016)(Citation: IBM TrickBot Nov 2016)(Citation: CrowdStrike Wizard Spider October 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Pupy
Software description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) is an open source, cross-platform (Windows, Linux, OSX, Android) remote administration and post-exploitation tool. (Citation: GitHub Pupy) It is written in Python and can be generated as a payload in several different ways (Windows exe, Python file, PowerShell oneliner/file, Linux elf, APK, Rubber Ducky, etc.). (Citation: GitHub Pupy) [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) is publicly available on GitHub. (Citation: GitHub Pupy)
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS, Android

Software name: SMOKEDHAM
Software description: [SMOKEDHAM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0649) is a Powershell-based .NET backdoor that was first reported in May 2021; it has been used by at least one ransomware-as-a-service affiliate.(Citation: FireEye Shining A Light on DARKSIDE May 2021)(Citation: FireEye SMOKEDHAM June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Valak
Software description: [Valak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0476) is a multi-stage modular malware that can function as a standalone information stealer or downloader, first observed in 2019 targeting enterprises in the US and Germany.(Citation: Cybereason Valak May 2020)(Citation: Unit 42 Valak July 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Exaramel for Windows
Software description: [Exaramel for Windows](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0343) is a backdoor used for targeting Windows systems. The Linux version is tracked separately under [Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401).(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Sardonic
Software description: [Sardonic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1085) is a backdoor written in C and C++ that is known to be used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061), as early as August 2021 to target a financial institution in the United States. [Sardonic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1085) has a plugin system that can load specially made DLLs and execute their functions.(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: IceApple
Software description: [IceApple](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1022) is a modular Internet Information Services (IIS) post-exploitation framework, that has been used since at least 2021 against the technology, academic, and government sectors.(Citation: CrowdStrike IceApple May 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: AsyncRAT
Software description: [AsyncRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1087) is an open-source remote access tool originally available through the NYANxCAT Github repository that has been used in malicious campaigns.(Citation: Morphisec Snip3 May 2021)(Citation: Cisco Operation Layover September 2021)(Citation: Telefonica Snip3 December 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SysUpdate
Software description: [SysUpdate](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0663) is a backdoor written in C++ that has been used by [Threat Group-3390](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G002

entities.name: WIZARD SPIDER
entities.description: Wizard Spider is a cybercriminal group known for developing and deploying malware, particularly targeting banking sites and involved in ransomware campaigns.

entities.name: FIN8
entities.description: FIN8 is a cybercriminal group known for targeting financial institutions and using sophisticated malware in its operations.

entities.name: THREAT GROUP-3390
entities.description: Threat Group-3390 is a cyber threat group associated with various cyber attacks and the use of specific malware tools.

entities.description: LitePower is a downloader and second stage malware used by WIRTE since at least 2021, targeting various platforms including Windows.

entities.name: CHAES
entities.description: Chaes is a multistage information stealer that collects sensitive information, primarily targeting victims in Brazil and Latin America since 2020.

entities.name: TRICKBOT
entities.description: TrickBot is a Trojan spyware program that emerged in 2016, used for targeting banking sites and involved in ransomware campaigns globally.

entities.name: PUPY
entities.description: Pupy is an open-source remote administration tool that can be used across multiple platforms, including Windows, Linux, and Android.

entities.name: SMOKEDHAM
entities.description: SMOKEDHAM is a Powershell-based backdoor reported in 2021, associated with ransomware-as-a-service operations.

entities.name: VALAK
entities.description: Valak is a multi-stage modular malware that functions as an information stealer or downloader, first observed in 2019 targeting enterprises.

entities.name: EXARAMEL FOR WINDOWS
entities.description: Exaramel for Windows is a backdoor targeting Windows systems, with a separate Linux version available.

entities.name: SARDONIC
entities.description: Sardonic is a backdoor used by FIN8 to target financial institutions in the United States, known for its plugin system.

entities.name: ICEAPPLE
entities.description: IceApple is a modular post-exploitation framework used against various sectors since at least 2021.

entities.name: ASYNC RAT
entities.description: AsyncRAT is an open-source remote access tool used in malicious campaigns, originally available through GitHub.

entities.name: SYSUPDATE
entities.description: SysUpdate is a backdoor written in C++ used by Threat Group-3390 in various cyber operations.

entities.name: NETWIRE
entities.description: Netwire is a remote access tool that has been used in various cyber attacks, often associated with cybercriminal activities.

entities.name: DARKSIDE
entities.description: DARKSIDE is a ransomware group known for its sophisticated attacks and operations targeting various sectors.

entities.description: Firuzi is a country mentioned in the context of hostage situations and financial negotiations.

entities.name: BRAZIL
entities.description: Brazil is a country primarily targeted by the Chaes malware for its e-commerce customers.

entities.name: LATIN AMERICA
entities.description: Latin America is a region where various cyber threats, including Chaes, have been observed targeting e-commerce customers.

Platforms: Windows

Software name: SysUpdate
Software description: [SysUpdate](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0663) is a backdoor written in C++ that has been used by [Threat Group-3390](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0027) since at least 2020.(Citation: Trend Micro Iron Tiger April 2021)
Platforms: Windows, Linux

Software name: KGH_SPY
Software description: [KGH_SPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0526) is a modular suite of tools used by [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) for reconnaissance, information stealing, and backdoor capabilities. [KGH_SPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0526) derived its name from PDB paths and internal names found in samples containing "KGH".(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: HALFBAKED
Software description: [HALFBAKED](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0151) is a malware family consisting of multiple components intended to establish persistence in victim networks. (Citation: FireEye FIN7 April 2017)
Platforms: None

Software name: Epic
Software description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) is a backdoor that has been used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010). (Citation: Kaspersky Turla)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Mafalda
Software description: [Mafalda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1060) is a flexible interactive implant that has been used by [Metador](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1013). Security researchers assess the [Mafalda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1060) name may be inspired by an Argentinian cartoon character that has been popular as a means of political commentary since the 1960s. (Citation: SentinelLabs Metador Sept 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: FunnyDream
Software description: [FunnyDream](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1044) is a backdoor with multiple components that was used during the [FunnyDream](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0007) campaign since at least 2019, primarily for execution and exfiltration.(Citation: Bitdefender FunnyDream Campaign November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Koadic
Software description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) is a Windows post-exploitation framework and penetration testing tool that is publicly available on GitHub. [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) has several options for staging payloads and creating implants, and performs most of its operations using Windows Script Host.(Citation: Github Koadic)(Citation: Palo Alto Sofacy 06-2018)(Citation: MalwareBytes LazyScripter Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Sliver
Software description: [Sliver](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0633) is an open source, cross-platform, red team command and control framework written in Golang.(Citation: Bishop Fox Sliver Framework August 2019)
Platforms: Windows, Linux, macOS

Software name: PolyglotDuke
Software description: [PolyglotDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0518) is a downloader that has been used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) since at least 2013. [PolyglotDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0518) has been used to drop [MiniDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0051).(Citation: ESET Dukes October 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Grandoreiro
Software description: [Grandoreiro](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0531) is a banking trojan written in Delphi that was first observed in 2016 and uses a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) business model. [Grandoreiro](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0531) has confirmed victims in Brazil, Mexico, Portugal, and Spain.(Citation: Securelist Brazilian Banking Malware July 2020)(Citation: ESET Grandoreiro April 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Prikormka
Software description: [Prikormka](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0113) is a malware family used in a campaign known as Operation Groundbait. It has predominantly been observed in Ukraine and was used as early as 2008. (Citation: ESET Operation Groundbait)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: StrifeWater
Software description: [StrifeWater](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1034) is a remote-access tool that has been used by [Moses Staff](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1009) in the initial stages of their attacks since at least November 2021.(Citation: Cybereason StrifeWater Feb 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: certutil
Software description: [certutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0160) is a command-line utility that can be used to obtain certificate authority information and configure Certificate Services.

chunk:
remote-access tool that has been used by [Moses Staff](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1009) in the initial stages of their attacks since at least November 2021.(Citation: Cybereason StrifeWater Feb 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: certutil
Software description: [certutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0160) is a command-line utility that can be used to obtain certificate authority information and configure Certificate Services. (Citation: TechNet Certutil)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Carbanak
Software description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Remcos
Software description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) is a closed-source tool that is marketed as a remote control and surveillance software by a company called Breaking Security. [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) has been observed being used in malware campaigns.(Citation: Riskiq Remcos Jan 2018)(Citation: Talos Remcos Aug 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Dok
Software description: [Dok](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0281) is a Trojan application disguised as a .zip file that is able to collect user credentials and install a malicious proxy server to redirect a user's network traffic (i.e. [Adversary-in-the-Middle](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1557)).(Citation: objsee mac malware 2017)(Citation: hexed osx.dok analysis 2019)(Citation: CheckPoint Dok)
Platforms: macOS

Software name: BONDUPDATER
Software description: [BONDUPDATER](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0360) is a PowerShell backdoor used by [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049). It was first observed in November 2017 during targeting of a Middle Eastern government organization, and an updated version was observed in August 2018 being used to target a government organization with spearphishing emails.(Citation: FireEye APT34 Dec 2017)(Citation: Palo Alto OilRig Sep 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SVCReady
Software description: [SVCReady](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1064) is a loader that has been used since at least April 2022 in malicious spam campaigns. Security researchers have noted overlaps between [TA551](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0127) activity and [SVCReady](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1064) distribution, including similarities in file names, lure images, and identical grammatical errors.(Citation: HP SVCReady Jun 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BlackCat
Software description: [BlackCat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1068) is ransomware written in Rust that has been offered via the Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model. First observed November 2021, [BlackCat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1068) has been used to target multiple sectors and organizations in various countries and regions in Africa, the Americas, Asia, Australia, and Europe.(Citation: Microsoft BlackCat Jun 2022)(Citation: Sophos BlackCat Jul 2022)(Citation: ACSC BlackCat Apr 2022)
Platforms: Linux, Windows

Software name: DarkTortilla
Software description: [DarkTortilla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1066) is a highly configurable .NET-based crypter that has been possibly active since at least August 2015. [DarkTortilla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1066) has been used to deliver popular information stealers, RATs, and payloads such as [Agent Tesla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0331), AsyncRat, [NanoCore](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0336), RedLine, [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154), and Metasploit.(Citation: Secureworks DarkTortilla Aug 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Black Basta
Software description: [Black Basta](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1070) is ransomware written in C++ that has been offered within the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) model since at least April 2022; there are variants that target Windows and VMWare ESXi servers. [Black Basta](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1070) operations have included the double extortion technique where in addition to demanding ransom for decrypting the files of targeted organizations the cyber actors also threaten to post sensitive information to a leak site if the ransom is not paid. [Black Basta](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1070) affiliates have targeted multiple high-value organizations, with the largest number of victims based in the U.S. Based on similarities in TTPs, leak sites, payment sites, and negotiation tactics, security researchers assess the [Black Basta](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1070) RaaS operators could include current or former members of the [Conti](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S057

entities.name: MOSES STAFF
entities.description: Moses Staff is a group known for using remote-access tools in cyber attacks since at least November 2021.

entities.name: CERTUTIL
entities.description: Certutil is a command-line utility used to obtain certificate authority information and configure Certificate Services on Windows platforms.

entities.name: CARBANAK
entities.description: Carbanak is a full-featured remote backdoor used for espionage and data exfiltration, associated with a group of the same name.

entities.name: REMOS
entities.description: Remcos is a remote control and surveillance software marketed by Breaking Security, used in various malware campaigns.

entities.name: DOK
entities.description: Dok is a Trojan application that collects user credentials and installs a malicious proxy server, disguised as a .zip file.

entities.name: BONDUPDATER
entities.description: BONDUPDATER is a PowerShell backdoor used by OilRig, first observed targeting a Middle Eastern government organization.

entities.name: SVCREADY
entities.description: SVCReady is a loader used in malicious spam campaigns, noted for overlaps with TA551 activity.

entities.name: BLACKCAT
entities.description: BlackCat is ransomware written in Rust, offered via Ransomware-as-a-Service, targeting multiple sectors globally.

entities.name: DARKTORTILLA
entities.description: DarkTortilla is a .NET-based crypter used to deliver various malware payloads, active since at least August 2015.

entities.name: BLACK BASTA
entities.description: Black Basta is ransomware written in C++, operating within a Ransomware-as-a-Service model, known for double extortion tactics.

entities.name: TA551
entities.description: TA551 is a threat actor group associated with malicious spam campaigns, noted for overlaps with the distribution of SVCReady.

entities.name: WINDOWS
entities.description: Windows is an operating system platform on which various software, including malware, is developed and executed.

entities.name: MACOS
entities.description: macOS is an operating system platform used for software like Dok, which targets users on Apple devices.

within a Ransomware-as-a-Service model, known for double extortion tactics.</data>      <data key="d2">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </node>    <node id="OILRIG">      <data key="d0" />      <data key="d1" />      <data key="d2">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </node>    <node id="TA551">      <data key="d0" />      <data key="d1">TA551 is a threat actor group associated with malicious spam campaigns, noted for overlaps with the distribution of SVCReady.</data>      <data key="d2">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>      <data key="d3">ORGANIZATION</data>    </node>    <node id="WINDOWS">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">Windows is an operating system platform on which various software, including malware, is developed and executed.</data>      <data key="d2">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </node>    <node id="MACOS">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">macOS is an operating system platform used for software like Dok, which targets users on Apple devices.</data>      <data key="d2">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </node>    <edge source="MOSES STAFF" target="CARBANAK">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">Moses Staff is known to use remote-access tools, including those associated with Carbanak, in their cyber attacks.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="MOSES STAFF" target="REMOS">      <data key="d4">5.0</data>      <data key="d5">Remcos has been observed being used in malware campaigns, which may include operations by Moses Staff.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="MOSES STAFF" target="DOK">      <data key="d4">5.0</data>      <data key="d5">Dok is a Trojan that could potentially be used by groups like Moses Staff in their cyber operations.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="DOK" target="WINDOWS">      <data key="d4">4.0</data>      <data key="d5">Dok is a Trojan that can collect user credentials on macOS, but its mention in the context of Windows indicates a broader relevance to malware operations.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="BONDUPDATER" target="OILRIG">      <data key="d4">18.0</data>      <data key="d5">BONDUPDATER is a backdoor specifically used by the OilRig group, establishing a direct relationship between the software and the organization.BONDUPDATER is a backdoor used by the OilRig group, indicating a direct relationship between the software and the organization.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="SVCREADY" target="TA551">      <data key="d4">12.0</data>      <data key="d5">SVCReady has been linked to TA551's malicious spam campaigns, indicating a relationship in their operational tactics.SVCReady has noted overlaps with TA551 activity, indicating a relationship in their operational tactics.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="BLACKCAT" target="BLACK BASTA">      <data key="d4">6.0</data>      <data key="d5">Both BlackCat and Black Basta are ransomware variants offered via Ransomware-as-a-Service, indicating a competitive relationship in the cybercrime landscape.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="BLACKCAT" target="DARKTORTILLA">      <data key="d4">1.0</data>      <data key="d5">DarkTortilla has been used to deliver payloads like BlackCat, indicating a relationship in malware delivery.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="BLACKCAT" target="WINDOWS">      <data key="d4">8.0</data>      <data key="d5">BlackCat ransomware is designed to target Windows systems, establishing a direct relationship with the platform.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>    <edge source="BLACK BASTA" target="WINDOWS">      <data key="d4">1.0</data>      <data key="d5">Black Basta ransomware targets Windows and VMWare ESXi servers, indicating a strong relationship with the platform.</data>      <data key="d6">dfd6e8ab6bd0ebe1871a9f32acb23f7b</data>    </edge>  </graph></graphml>

chunk:
paid. [Black Basta](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1070) affiliates have targeted multiple high-value organizations, with the largest number of victims based in the U.S. Based on similarities in TTPs, leak sites, payment sites, and negotiation tactics, security researchers assess the [Black Basta](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1070) RaaS operators could include current or former members of the [Conti](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0575) group.(Citation: Palo Alto Networks Black Basta August 2022)(Citation: Deep Instinct Black Basta August 2022)(Citation: Minerva Labs Black Basta May 2022)(Citation: Avertium Black Basta June 2022)(Citation: NCC Group Black Basta June 2022)(Citation: Cyble Black Basta May 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Lucifer
Software description: [Lucifer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0532) is a crypto miner and DDoS hybrid malware that leverages well-known exploits to spread laterally on Windows platforms.(Citation: Unit 42 Lucifer June 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Octopus
Software description: [Octopus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0340) is a Windows Trojan written in the Delphi programming language that has been used by [Nomadic Octopus](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0133) to target government organizations in Central Asia since at least 2014.(Citation: Securelist Octopus Oct 2018)(Citation: Security Affairs DustSquad Oct 2018)(Citation: ESET Nomadic Octopus 2018) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: MoleNet
Software description: [MoleNet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0553) is a downloader tool with backdoor capabilities that has been observed in use since at least 2019.(Citation: Cybereason Molerats Dec 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RTM
Software description: [RTM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0148) is custom malware written in Delphi. It is used by the group of the same name ([RTM](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0048)). Newer versions of the malware have been reported publicly as Redaman.(Citation: ESET RTM Feb 2017)(Citation: Unit42 Redaman January 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RDAT
Software description: [RDAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0495) is a backdoor used by the suspected Iranian threat group [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049). [RDAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0495) was originally identified in 2017 and targeted companies in the telecommunications sector.(Citation: Unit42 RDAT July 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Socksbot
Software description: [Socksbot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0273) is a backdoor that  abuses Socket Secure (SOCKS) proxies. (Citation: TrendMicro Patchwork Dec 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Bad Rabbit
Software description: [Bad Rabbit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0606) is a self-propagating ransomware that affected the Ukrainian transportation sector in 2017. [Bad Rabbit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0606) has also targeted organizations and consumers in Russia. (Citation: Secure List Bad Rabbit)(Citation: ESET Bad Rabbit)(Citation: Dragos IT ICS Ransomware) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Agent Tesla
Software description: [Agent Tesla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0331) is a spyware Trojan written for the .NET framework that has been observed since at least 2014.(Citation: Fortinet Agent Tesla April 2018)(Citation: Bitdefender Agent Tesla April 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Agent Tesla April 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BADNEWS
Software description: [BADNEWS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0128) is malware that has been used by the actors responsible for the [Patchwork](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0040) campaign. Its name was given due to its use of RSS feeds, forums, and blogs for command and control. (Citation: Forcepoint Monsoon) (Citation: TrendMicro Patchwork Dec 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ThreatNeedle
Software description: [ThreatNeedle](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0665) is a backdoor that has been used by [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032) since at least 2019 to target cryptocurrency, defense, and mobile gaming organizations.  It is considered to be an advanced cluster of [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032)'s Manuscrypt (a.k.a. NukeSped) malware family.(Citation: Kaspersky ThreatNeedle Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TYPEFRAME
Software description: [TYPEFRAME](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0263) is a remote access tool that has been used by [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032). (Citation: US-CERT TYPEFRAME June 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BADHATCH
Software description: [BADHATCH](https://attack.mitre.org/software

entities.name: BLACK BASTA
entities.description: Black Basta is a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group that has targeted multiple high-value organizations, primarily in the U.S., using various tactics and techniques for negotiation and payment.

entities.name: CONTIGROUP
entities.description: Conti is a notorious ransomware group known for its sophisticated attacks and operations, which may include members of Black Basta.

entities.name: LUCIFER
entities.description: Lucifer is a crypto miner and DDoS hybrid malware that exploits vulnerabilities to spread on Windows platforms.

entities.name: OCTOPUS
entities.description: Octopus is a Windows Trojan used by Nomadic Octopus to target government organizations in Central Asia since at least 2014.

entities.name: MOLENET
entities.description: MoleNet is a downloader tool with backdoor capabilities that has been in use since at least 2019.

entities.name: RTM
entities.description: RTM is custom malware used by the RTM group, with newer versions reported as Redaman.

entities.name: RDAT
entities.description: RDAT is a backdoor used by the Iranian threat group OilRig, originally identified in 2017, targeting telecommunications companies.

entities.name: SOCKSBOT
entities.description: Socksbot is a backdoor that abuses Socket Secure (SOCKS) proxies.

entities.name: BAD RABBIT
entities.description: Bad Rabbit is a self-propagating ransomware that affected the Ukrainian transportation sector in 2017 and has also targeted organizations in Russia.

entities.name: AGENT TESLA
entities.description: Agent Tesla is a spyware Trojan written for the .NET framework, observed since at least 2014.

entities.name: BADNEWS
entities.description: BADNEWS is malware used by the actors behind the Patchwork campaign, utilizing RSS feeds and blogs for command and control.

entities.name: THREATNEEDLE
entities.description: ThreatNeedle is a backdoor used by the Lazarus Group to target various sectors, including cryptocurrency and defense.

entities.name: TYPEFRAME
entities.description: TYPEFRAME is a remote access tool used by the Lazarus Group.

entities.name: OILRIG
entities.description: OilRig is an Iranian threat group known for its cyber espionage and attacks, particularly in the telecommunications sector.

entities.name: LAZARUS GROUP
entities.description: Lazarus Group is a North Korean cybercrime organization responsible for various high-profile cyber attacks, including those targeting cryptocurrency and defense sectors.

chunk:
Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TYPEFRAME
Software description: [TYPEFRAME](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0263) is a remote access tool that has been used by [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032). (Citation: US-CERT TYPEFRAME June 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BADHATCH
Software description: [BADHATCH](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1081) is a backdoor that has been utilized by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) since at least 2019. [BADHATCH](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1081) has been used to target the insurance, retail, technology, and chemical industries in the United States, Canada, South Africa, Panama, and Italy.(Citation: Gigamon BADHATCH Jul 2019)(Citation: BitDefender BADHATCH Mar 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: IronNetInjector
Software description: [IronNetInjector](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0581) is a [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) toolchain that utilizes scripts from the open-source IronPython implementation of Python with a .NET injector to drop one or more payloads including [ComRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0126).(Citation: Unit 42 IronNetInjector February 2021 )
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Pteranodon
Software description: [Pteranodon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0147) is a custom backdoor used by [Gamaredon Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0047). (Citation: Palo Alto Gamaredon Feb 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Ursnif
Software description: [Ursnif](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0386) is a banking trojan and variant of the Gozi malware observed being spread through various automated exploit kits, [Spearphishing Attachment](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1566/001)s, and malicious links.(Citation: NJCCIC Ursnif Sept 2016)(Citation: ProofPoint Ursnif Aug 2016) [Ursnif](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0386) is associated primarily with data theft, but variants also include components (backdoors, spyware, file injectors, etc.) capable of a wide variety of behaviors.(Citation: TrendMicro Ursnif Mar 2015)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RedLeaves
Software description: [RedLeaves](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0153) is a malware family used by [menuPass](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0045). The code overlaps with [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) and may be based upon the open source tool Trochilus. (Citation: PWC Cloud Hopper Technical Annex April 2017) (Citation: FireEye APT10 April 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Okrum
Software description: [Okrum](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0439) is a Windows backdoor that has been seen in use since December 2016 with strong links to [Ke3chang](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0004).(Citation: ESET Okrum July 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RogueRobin
Software description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) is a payload used by [DarkHydrus](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0079) that has been developed in PowerShell and C#. (Citation: Unit 42 DarkHydrus July 2018)(Citation: Unit42 DarkHydrus Jan 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Maze
Software description: [Maze](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0449) ransomware, previously known as "ChaCha", was discovered in May 2019. In addition to encrypting files on victim machines for impact, [Maze](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0449) operators conduct information stealing campaigns prior to encryption and post the information online to extort affected companies.(Citation: FireEye Maze May 2020)(Citation: McAfee Maze March 2020)(Citation: Sophos Maze VM September 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: HELLOKITTY
Software description: [HELLOKITTY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0617) is a ransomware written in C++  that shares similar code structure and functionality with [DEATHRANSOM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0616) and [FIVEHANDS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0618). [HELLOKITTY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0617) has been used since at least 2020, targets have included a Polish video game developer and a Brazilian electric power company.(Citation: FireEye FiveHands April 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CORALDECK
Software description: [CORALDECK](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0212) is an exfiltration tool used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067). (Citation: FireEye APT37 Feb 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PUNCHBUGGY
Software description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a back

entities.name: LAZARUS GROUP
entities.description: Lazarus Group is a cybercrime organization known for its sophisticated hacking techniques and has been linked to various cyber attacks globally.

entities.name: FIN8
entities.description: FIN8 is a cybercriminal group that has targeted financial institutions and businesses, particularly in the insurance and retail sectors.

entities.name: TURNA
entities.description: Turla is a Russian cyber espionage group known for its advanced persistent threat (APT) activities and sophisticated malware.

entities.name: GAMAREDON GROUP
entities.description: Gamaredon Group is a cyber espionage group that has been linked to attacks against Ukrainian entities and is known for its use of custom malware.

entities.name: MENU PASS
entities.description: menuPass is a cybercriminal group associated with various malware campaigns and cyber attacks.

entities.name: KE3CHANG
entities.description: Ke3chang is a cyber espionage group that has been involved in targeted attacks against various sectors, particularly in Asia.

entities.name: DARKHYDRUS
entities.description: DarkHydrus is a cybercriminal group known for its use of PowerShell-based malware and targeting organizations in the Middle East.

entities.name: MAZE
entities.description:
Maze is a ransomware group that not only encrypts files but also steals data to extort victims.
Maze is a ransomware group known for encrypting files and stealing data to extort victims.

entities.name: HELLOKITTY
entities.description: HELLOKITTY is a ransomware variant that has targeted various organizations, known for its aggressive tactics.

entities.name: CORALDECK
entities.description: CORALDECK is an exfiltration tool used by APT37 for data theft and espionage.

entities.name: PUNCHBUGGY
entities.description: PUNCHBUGGY is a backdoor tool used in cyber attacks, though specific details about its operations are less documented.

entities.name: BADHATCH
entities.description: BADHATCH is a backdoor that has been utilized in cyber attacks, particularly by FIN8, targeting multiple industries.

entities.name: IRONNETINJECTOR
entities.description: IronNetInjector is a toolchain used by Turla for deploying malware and conducting cyber espionage.

entities.name: PTERANODON
entities.description: Pteranodon is a custom backdoor associated with Gamaredon Group, used in their cyber operations.

entities.name: OKRUM
entities.description: Okrum is a Windows backdoor linked to Ke3chang, indicating its use in targeted cyber attacks.

entities.name: ROGUEROBIN
entities.description: RogueRobin is a payload developed by DarkHydrus, showcasing their use of PowerShell and C# in cyber attacks.

chunk:
Software name: CORALDECK
Software description: [CORALDECK](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0212) is an exfiltration tool used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067). (Citation: FireEye APT37 Feb 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PUNCHBUGGY
Software description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: MCMD
Software description: [MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) is a remote access tool that provides remote command shell capability used by [Dragonfly 2.0](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0074).(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Dridex
Software description: [Dridex](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0384) is a prolific banking Trojan that first appeared in 2014. By December 2019, the US Treasury estimated [Dridex](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0384) had infected computers in hundreds of banks and financial institutions in over 40 countries, leading to more than $100 million in theft. [Dridex](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0384) was created from the source code of the Bugat banking Trojan (also known as Cridex).(Citation: Dell Dridex Oct 2015)(Citation: Kaspersky Dridex May 2017)(Citation: Treasury EvilCorp Dec 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ObliqueRAT
Software description: [ObliqueRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0644) is a remote access trojan, similar to [Crimson](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0115), that has been in use by [Transparent Tribe](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0134) since at least 2020.(Citation: Talos Oblique RAT March 2021)(Citation: Talos Transparent Tribe May 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Remexi
Software description: [Remexi](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0375) is a Windows-based Trojan that was developed in the C programming language.(Citation: Securelist Remexi Jan 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CosmicDuke
Software description: [CosmicDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0050) is malware that was used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) from 2010 to 2015. (Citation: F-Secure The Dukes)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PlugX
Software description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) is a remote access tool (RAT) with modular plugins that has been used by multiple threat groups.(Citation: Lastline PlugX Analysis)(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox Part 2)(Citation: New DragonOK)(Citation: Dell TG-3390)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: InvisiMole
Software description: [InvisiMole](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0260) is a modular spyware program that has been used by the InvisiMole Group since at least 2013. [InvisiMole](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0260) has two backdoor modules called RC2FM and RC2CL that are used to perform post-exploitation activities. It has been discovered on compromised victims in the Ukraine and Russia. [Gamaredon Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0047) infrastructure has been used to download and execute [InvisiMole](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0260) against a small number of victims.(Citation: ESET InvisiMole June 2018)(Citation: ESET InvisiMole June 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SUNBURST
Software description: [SUNBURST](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0559) is a trojanized DLL designed to fit within the SolarWinds Orion software update framework. It was used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) since at least February 2020.(Citation: SolarWinds Sunburst Sunspot Update January 2021)(Citation: Microsoft Deep Dive Solorigate January 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: FELIXROOT
Software description: [FELIXROOT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0267) is a backdoor that has been used to target Ukrainian victims. (Citation: FireEye FELIXROOT July 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CrackMapExec
Software description: [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488), or CME, is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python and designed for penetration testing against networks. [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488) collects Active Directory information to conduct lateral movement through targeted networks.(Citation: CME Github September 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software

entities.name: CORALDECK
entities.description: CORALDECK is an exfiltration tool used by APT37 for data extraction purposes.

entities.name: APT37
entities.description: APT37 is a cyber threat group known for using various malware tools, including CORALDECK.

entities.name: PUNCHBUGGY
entities.description: PUNCHBUGGY is a backdoor malware used by FIN8, targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry.

entities.name: FIN8
entities.description:
FIN8 is a cybercriminal group that employs various malware, including PUNCHBUGGY, to exploit financial systems.
FIN8 is a cybercriminal group that employs various malware, including PUNCHBUGGY, to exploit financial systems, particularly in the hospitality industry.

entities.name: MCMD
entities.description: MCMD is a remote access tool used by Dragonfly 2.0 to provide command shell capabilities.

entities.name: DRIDEX
entities.description: DRIDEX is a banking Trojan that has caused significant financial theft since its emergence in 2014.

entities.name: OBLIQUERAT
entities.description: OBLIQUERAT is a remote access trojan used by Transparent Tribe since at least 2020.

entities.name: TRANSPARENT TRIBE
entities.description:
TRANSPARENT TRIBE is a cyber threat group known for using OBLIQUERAT for espionage activities.
TRANSPARENT TRIBE is a cyber threat group that has been associated with the use of OBLIQUERAT for espionage activities.

entities.name: REMEIXI
entities.description: REMEIXI is a Windows-based Trojan developed in the C programming language.

entities.name: COSMICDUKE
entities.description: COSMICDUKE is malware used by APT29 from 2010 to 2015 for various cyber operations.

entities.name: APT29
entities.description: APT29 is a cyber threat group known for sophisticated cyber espionage activities, including the use of COSMICDUKE.

entities.name: PLUGX
entities.description: PLUGX is a remote access tool with modular plugins used by multiple threat groups for various cyber attacks.

entities.name: INVISIMOLE
entities.description: INVISIMOLE is a modular spyware program used by the InvisiMole Group for post-exploitation activities.

entities.name: INVISIMOLE GROUP
entities.description: INVISIMOLE GROUP is a cyber threat group that utilizes INVISIMOLE for espionage and data theft.

entities.name: SUNBURST
entities.description: SUNBURST is a trojanized DLL used within the SolarWinds Orion software update framework by APT29.

entities.name: FELIXROOT
entities.description: FELIXROOT is a backdoor targeting Ukrainian victims, used by various cyber threat actors.

entities.name: CRACKMAPEXEC
entities.description: CRACKMAPEXEC is a post-exploitation tool designed for penetration testing against networks.

entities.name: GAMAREDON GROUP
entities.description:
GAMAREDON GROUP is a cyber threat group that has been associated with the use of INVISIMOLE against victims.
GAMAREDON GROUP is a cyber threat group that has been linked to the use of INVISIMOLE against victims in Ukraine and Russia.

entities.name: DRAGONFLY 2.0
entities.description: DRAGONFLY 2.0 is a cyber threat group known for using MCMD as a remote access tool for cyber operations.

8)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CrackMapExec
Software description: [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488), or CME, is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python and designed for penetration testing against networks. [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488) collects Active Directory information to conduct lateral movement through targeted networks.(Citation: CME Github September 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Akira
Software description: [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1129) ransomware, written in C++, is most prominently (but not exclusively) associated with the a ransomware-as-a-service entity [Akira](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1024).(Citation: Kersten Akira 2023)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SharpStage
Software description: [SharpStage](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0546) is a .NET malware with backdoor capabilities.(Citation: Cybereason Molerats Dec 2020)(Citation: BleepingComputer Molerats Dec 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: DEATHRANSOM
Software description: [DEATHRANSOM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0616) is ransomware written in C that has been used since at least 2020, and has potential overlap with [FIVEHANDS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0618) and [HELLOKITTY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0617).(Citation: FireEye FiveHands April 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Penquin
Software description: [Penquin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0587) is a remote access trojan (RAT) with multiple versions used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) to target Linux systems since at least 2014.(Citation: Kaspersky Turla Penquin December 2014)(Citation: Leonardo Turla Penquin May 2020)
Platforms: Linux

Software name: Trojan.Karagany
Software description: [Trojan.Karagany](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0094) is a modular remote access tool used for recon and linked to [Dragonfly](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0035). The source code for [Trojan.Karagany](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0094) originated from Dream Loader malware which was leaked in 2010 and sold on underground forums. (Citation: Symantec Dragonfly)(Citation: Secureworks Karagany July 2019)(Citation: Dragos DYMALLOY )
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ECCENTRICBANDWAGON
Software description: [ECCENTRICBANDWAGON](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0593) is a remote access Trojan (RAT) used by North Korean cyber actors that was first identified in August 2020. It is a reconnaissance tool--with keylogging and screen capture functionality--used for information gathering on compromised systems.(Citation: CISA EB Aug 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ComRAT
Software description: [ComRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0126) is a second stage implant suspected of being a descendant of [Agent.btz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0092) and used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010). The first version of [ComRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0126) was identified in 2007, but the tool has undergone substantial development for many years since.(Citation: Symantec Waterbug)(Citation: NorthSec 2015 GData Uroburos Tools)(Citation: ESET ComRAT May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Green Lambert
Software description: [Green Lambert](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0690) is a modular backdoor that security researchers assess has been used by an advanced threat group referred to as Longhorn and The Lamberts. First reported in 2017, the Windows variant of [Green Lambert](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0690) may have been used as early as 2008; a macOS version was uploaded to a multiscanner service in September 2014.(Citation: Kaspersky Lamberts Toolkit April 2017)(Citation: Objective See Green Lambert for OSX Oct 2021)  
Platforms: Windows, iOS, macOS, Linux

Software name: OopsIE
Software description: [OopsIE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0264) is a Trojan used by [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049) to remotely execute commands as well as upload/download files to/from victims. (Citation: Unit 42 OopsIE! Feb 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Milan
Software description: [Milan](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1015) is a backdoor implant based on [DanBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1014) that was written in Visual C++ and .NET. [Milan](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1015) has been used by [HEXANE](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1001) since at least June 2020.(Citation: ClearSky Siamesekitten August 2021)(Citation: Kaspersky Lyceum October 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PowerSploit
Software description: [PowerSploit

entities.name: CRACKMAPEXEC
entities.description: CrackMapExec is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python for penetration testing against networks, designed to collect Active Directory information for lateral movement.

entities.name: AKIRA
entities.description: Akira is a ransomware written in C++ associated with a ransomware-as-a-service entity, primarily targeting systems for financial gain.

entities.name: SHARPSTAGE
entities.description: SharpStage is a .NET malware with backdoor capabilities, used for unauthorized access and control over infected systems.

entities.name: DEATHRANSOM
entities.description: DEATHRANSOM is a ransomware written in C that has been in use since at least 2020, known for its potential overlap with other ransomware families.

entities.name: PENQUIN
entities.description: Penquin is a remote access trojan (RAT) used by the Turla group to target Linux systems since at least 2014.

entities.name: TROJAN.KARAGANY
entities.description: Trojan.Karagany is a modular remote access tool linked to the Dragonfly group, originally derived from leaked Dream Loader malware.

entities.name: ECCENTRICBANDWAGON
entities.description: ECCENTRICBANDWAGON is a remote access Trojan used by North Korean cyber actors for reconnaissance and information gathering.

entities.name: COMRAT
entities.description: ComRAT is a second stage implant suspected to be a descendant of Agent.btz, used by the Turla group for advanced cyber operations.

entities.name: GREEN LAMBERT
entities.description: Green Lambert is a modular backdoor associated with the Longhorn threat group, used for unauthorized access and control over systems.

entities.name: OOPSIE
entities.description: OopsIE is a Trojan used by OilRig for remote command execution and file manipulation on victim systems.

entities.name: MILAN
entities.description: Milan is a backdoor implant used by the HEXANE group, based on DanBot and written in Visual C++ and .NET.

entities.name: OILRIG
entities.description: OilRig is a cyber threat group that conducts cyber espionage and attacks, primarily targeting organizations in the Middle East.

entities.name: FIVEHANDS
entities.description: FiveHands is a ransomware group known for its targeted attacks and use of sophisticated techniques to extort victims.

entities.name: HELLOKITTY
entities.description: HelloKitty is a ransomware group that has been involved in high-profile attacks, encrypting data and demanding ransom for decryption.

Platforms: Windows

Software name: PowerSploit
Software description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) is an open source, offensive security framework comprised of [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1059/001) modules and scripts that perform a wide range of tasks related to penetration testing such as code execution, persistence, bypassing anti-virus, recon, and exfiltration. (Citation: GitHub PowerSploit May 2012) (Citation: PowerShellMagazine PowerSploit July 2014) (Citation: PowerSploit Documentation)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Lizar
Software description: [Lizar](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0681) is a modular remote access tool written using the .NET Framework that shares structural similarities to [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030). It has likely been used by [FIN7](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0046) since at least February 2021.(Citation: BiZone Lizar May 2021)(Citation: Threatpost Lizar May 2021)(Citation: Gemini FIN7 Oct 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Uroburos
Software description: [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) is a sophisticated cyber espionage tool written in C that has been used by units within Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) associated with the [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) toolset to collect intelligence on sensitive targets worldwide. [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) has several variants and has undergone nearly constant upgrade since its initial development in 2003 to keep it viable after public disclosures. [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) is typically deployed to external-facing nodes on a targeted network and has the ability to leverage additional tools and TTPs to further exploit an internal network. [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) has interoperable implants for Windows, Linux, and macOS, employs a high level of stealth in communications and architecture, and can easily incorporate new or replacement components.(Citation: Joint Cybersecurity Advisory AA23-129A Snake Malware May 2023)(Citation: Kaspersky Turla)
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS

Software name: Pillowmint
Software description: [Pillowmint](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0517) is a point-of-sale malware used by [FIN7](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0046) designed to capture credit card information.(Citation: Trustwave Pillowmint June 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: EVILNUM
Software description: [EVILNUM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0568) is fully capable backdoor that was first identified in 2018. [EVILNUM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0568) is used by the APT group [Evilnum](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0120) which has the same name.(Citation: ESET EvilNum July 2020)(Citation: Prevailion EvilNum May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: gh0st RAT
Software description: [gh0st RAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0032) is a remote access tool (RAT). The source code is public and it has been used by multiple groups.(Citation: FireEye Hacking Team)(Citation: Arbor Musical Chairs Feb 2018)(Citation: Nccgroup Gh0st April 2018)
Platforms: Windows, macOS

Software name: HiddenWasp
Software description: [HiddenWasp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0394) is a Linux-based Trojan used to target systems for remote control. It comes in the form of a statically linked ELF binary with stdlibc++.(Citation: Intezer HiddenWasp Map 2019)
Platforms: Linux

Software name: SharpDisco
Software description: [SharpDisco](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1089) is a dropper developed in C# that has been used by [MoustachedBouncer](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1019) since at least 2020 to load malicious plugins.(Citation: MoustachedBouncer ESET August 2023)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ZxxZ
Software description: [ZxxZ](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1013) is a trojan written in Visual C++ that has been used by [BITTER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1002) since at least August 2021, including against Bangladeshi government personnel.(Citation: Cisco Talos Bitter Bangladesh May 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: QuasarRAT
Software description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) is an open-source, remote access tool that has been publicly available on GitHub since at least 2014. [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) is developed in the C# language.(Citation: GitHub Qu

Platforms: Windows

Software name: QuasarRAT
Software description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) is an open-source, remote access tool that has been publicly available on GitHub since at least 2014. [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) is developed in the C# language.(Citation: GitHub QuasarRAT)(Citation: Volexity Patchwork June 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Bumblebee
Software description: [Bumblebee](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1039) is a custom loader written in C++ that has been used by multiple threat actors, including possible initial access brokers, to download and execute additional payloads since at least March 2022. [Bumblebee](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1039) has been linked to ransomware operations including [Conti](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0575), Quantum, and Mountlocker and derived its name from the appearance of "bumblebee" in the user-agent.(Citation: Google EXOTIC LILY March 2022)(Citation: Proofpoint Bumblebee April 2022)(Citation: Symantec Bumblebee June 2022)

Platforms: Windows

Software name: Matryoshka
Software description: [Matryoshka](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0167) is a malware framework used by [CopyKittens](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0052) that consists of a dropper, loader, and RAT. It has multiple versions; v1 was seen in the wild from July 2016 until January 2017. v2 has fewer commands and other minor differences. (Citation: ClearSky Wilted Tulip July 2017) (Citation: CopyKittens Nov 2015)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: WannaCry
Software description: [WannaCry](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0366) is ransomware that was first seen in a global attack during May 2017, which affected more than 150 countries. It contains worm-like features to spread itself across a computer network using the SMBv1 exploit EternalBlue.(Citation: LogRhythm WannaCry)(Citation: US-CERT WannaCry 2017)(Citation: Washington Post WannaCry 2017)(Citation: FireEye WannaCry 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Netwalker
Software description: [Netwalker](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0457) is fileless ransomware written in PowerShell and executed directly in memory.(Citation: TrendMicro Netwalker May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SoreFang
Software description: [SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) is first stage downloader used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) for exfiltration and to load other malware.(Citation: NCSC APT29 July 2020)(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: FIVEHANDS
Software description: [FIVEHANDS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0618) is a customized version of [DEATHRANSOM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0616) ransomware written in C++. [FIVEHANDS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0618) has been used since at least 2021, including in Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) campaigns, sometimes along with [SombRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0615).(Citation: FireEye FiveHands April 2021)(Citation: NCC Group Fivehands June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Mispadu
Software description: [Mispadu](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1122) is a banking trojan written in Delphi that was first observed in 2019 and uses a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) business model.(Citation: ESET Security Mispadu Facebook Ads 2019)(Citation: SCILabs Malteiro 2021) This malware is operated, managed, and sold by the [Malteiro](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1026) cybercriminal group.(Citation: SCILabs Malteiro 2021) [Mispadu](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1122) has mainly been used to target victims in Brazil and Mexico, and has also had confirmed operations throughout Latin America and Europe.(Citation: SCILabs Malteiro 2021)(Citation: SCILabs URSA/Mispadu Evolution 2023)(Citation: Segurança Informática URSA Sophisticated Loader 2020) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: metaMain
Software description: [metaMain](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1059) is a backdoor used by [Metador](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1013) to maintain long-term access to compromised machines; it has also been used to decrypt [Mafalda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1060) into memory.(Citation: SentinelLabs Metador Sept 2022)(Citation: SentinelLabs Metador Technical Appendix Sept 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: HyperBro
Software description: [HyperBro](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S039

entities.name: QUASARRAT
entities.description: QuasarRAT is an open-source remote access tool developed in C# and publicly available on GitHub since at least 2014.

entities.name: BUMBLEBEE
entities.description: Bumblebee is a custom loader written in C++ used by multiple threat actors to download and execute additional payloads since at least March 2022.

entities.name: MATRYOSHKA
entities.description: Matryoshka is a malware framework used by CopyKittens that consists of a dropper, loader, and RAT, with multiple versions observed in the wild.

entities.name: WANACRY
entities.description: WannaCry is ransomware first seen in a global attack during May 2017, affecting more than 150 countries with worm-like features.

entities.name: NETWALKER
entities.description: Netwalker is fileless ransomware written in PowerShell, executed directly in memory.

entities.name: SOREFANG
entities.description: SoreFang is a first stage downloader used by APT29 for exfiltration and to load other malware.

entities.name: FIVEHANDS
entities.description: FIVEHANDS is a customized version of DEATHRANSOM ransomware written in C++, used in Ransomware-as-a-Service campaigns since at least 2021.

entities.name: MISPADU
entities.description: Mispadu is a banking trojan written in Delphi, first observed in 2019, operated by the Malteiro cybercriminal group.

entities.name: METAMAIN
entities.description: metaMain is a backdoor used by Metador to maintain long-term access to compromised machines.

entities.name: APT29
entities.description: APT29 is a cyber espionage group known for using SoreFang as a first stage downloader for exfiltration and loading other malware.

entities.name: CONTIN
entities.description: Conti is a ransomware operation that has been linked to the use of Bumblebee in its campaigns.

entities.name: QUANTUM
entities.description: Quantum is another ransomware operation associated with Bumblebee, indicating its use in various cyber attacks.

entities.name: MOUNTLOCKER
entities.description: Mountlocker is a ransomware group that has been linked to Bumblebee, showcasing its role in ransomware operations.

entities.name: MAFALDA
entities.description: Mafalda is a software that can be decrypted by metaMain, indicating its relevance in the context of malware operations.

Platforms: Windows

Software name: HyperBro
Software description: [HyperBro](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0398) is a custom in-memory backdoor used by [Threat Group-3390](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0027).(Citation: Unit42 Emissary Panda May 2019)(Citation: Securelist LuckyMouse June 2018)(Citation: Hacker News LuckyMouse June 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Responder
Software description: Responder is an open source tool used for LLMNR, NBT-NS and MDNS poisoning, with built-in HTTP/SMB/MSSQL/FTP/LDAP rogue authentication server supporting NTLMv1/NTLMv2/LMv2, Extended Security NTLMSSP and Basic HTTP authentication. (Citation: GitHub Responder)
Platforms: None

Software name: Chrommme
Software description: [Chrommme](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0667) is a backdoor tool written using the Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC) framework that was first reported in June 2021; security researchers noted infrastructure overlaps with [Gelsemium](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0666) malware.(Citation: ESET Gelsemium June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Derusbi
Software description: [Derusbi](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0021) is malware used by multiple Chinese APT groups.(Citation: Novetta-Axiom)(Citation: ThreatConnect Anthem) Both Windows and Linux variants have been observed.(Citation: Fidelis Turbo)
Platforms: Windows, Linux

Software name: zwShell
Software description: [zwShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0350) is a remote access tool (RAT) written in Delphi that has been seen in the wild since the spring of 2010 and used by threat actors during [Night Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0002).(Citation: McAfee Night Dragon)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RemoteUtilities
Software description: [RemoteUtilities](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0592) is a legitimate remote administration tool that has been used by [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) since at least 2021 for execution on target machines.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ConnectWise
Software description: [ConnectWise](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0591) is a legitimate remote administration tool that has been used since at least 2016 by threat actors including [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) and [GOLD SOUTHFIELD](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0115) to connect to and conduct lateral movement in target environments.(Citation: Anomali Static Kitten February 2021)(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PipeMon
Software description: [PipeMon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0501) is a multi-stage modular backdoor used by [Winnti Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0044).(Citation: ESET PipeMon May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: QUADAGENT
Software description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) is a PowerShell backdoor used by [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049). (Citation: Unit 42 QUADAGENT July 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Brute Ratel C4
Software description: [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) is a commercial red-teaming and adversarial attack simulation tool that first appeared in December 2020. [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was specifically designed to avoid detection by endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus (AV) capabilities, and deploys agents called badgers to enable arbitrary command execution for lateral movement, privilege escalation, and persistence. In September 2022, a cracked version of [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was leaked in the cybercriminal underground, leading to its use by threat actors.(Citation: Dark Vortex Brute Ratel C4)(Citation: Palo Alto Brute Ratel July 2022)(Citation: MDSec Brute Ratel August 2022)(Citation: SANS Brute Ratel October 2022)(Citation: Trend Micro Black Basta October 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CrossRAT
Software description: [CrossRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0235) is a cross platform RAT.
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS

Software name: UPPERCUT
Software description: [UPPERCUT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0275) is a backdoor that has been used by [menuPass](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0045). (Citation: FireEye APT10 Sept 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Meteor
Software description

chunk:

Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS

Software name: UPPERCUT
Software description: [UPPERCUT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0275) is a backdoor that has been used by [menuPass](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0045). (Citation: FireEye APT10 Sept 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Meteor
Software description: [Meteor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0688) is a wiper that was used against Iranian government organizations, including Iranian Railways, the Ministry of Roads, and Urban Development systems, in July 2021. [Meteor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0688) is likely a newer version of similar wipers called Stardust and Comet that were reportedly used by a group called "Indra" since at least 2019 against private companies in Syria.(Citation: Check Point Meteor Aug 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Volgmer
Software description: [Volgmer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0180) is a backdoor Trojan designed to provide covert access to a compromised system. It has been used since at least 2013 to target the government, financial, automotive, and media industries. Its primary delivery mechanism is suspected to be spearphishing. (Citation: US-CERT Volgmer Nov 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Anchor
Software description: [Anchor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0504) is one of a family of backdoor malware that has been used in conjunction with [TrickBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0266) on selected high profile targets since at least 2018.(Citation: Cyberreason Anchor December 2019)(Citation: Medium Anchor DNS July 2020)
Platforms: Linux, Windows

Software name: Cobian RAT
Software description: [Cobian RAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0338) is a backdoor, remote access tool that has been observed since 2016.(Citation: Zscaler Cobian Aug 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Attor
Software description: [Attor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0438) is a Windows-based espionage platform that has been seen in use since 2013. [Attor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0438) has a loadable plugin architecture to customize functionality for specific targets.(Citation: ESET Attor Oct 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: GrimAgent
Software description: [GrimAgent](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0632) is a backdoor that has been used before the deployment of [Ryuk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0446) ransomware since at least 2020; it is likely used by [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) and [Wizard Spider](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0102).(Citation: Group IB GrimAgent July 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Machete
Software description: [Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0409) is a cyber espionage toolset used by [Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095). It is a Python-based backdoor targeting Windows machines that was first observed in 2010.(Citation: ESET Machete July 2019)(Citation: Securelist Machete Aug 2014)(Citation: 360 Machete Sep 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Metamorfo
Software description: [Metamorfo](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0455) is a Latin-American banking trojan operated by a Brazilian cybercrime group that has been active since at least April 2018. The group focuses on targeting banks and cryptocurrency services in Brazil and Mexico.(Citation: Medium Metamorfo Apr 2020)(Citation: ESET Casbaneiro Oct 2019) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SHUTTERSPEED
Software description: [SHUTTERSPEED](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0217) is a backdoor used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067). (Citation: FireEye APT37 Feb 2018)
Platforms: None

Software name: HermeticWiper
Software description: [HermeticWiper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0697) is a data wiper that has been used since at least early 2022, primarily against Ukraine with additional activity observed in Latvia and Lithuania. Some sectors targeted include government, financial, defense, aviation, and IT services.(Citation: SentinelOne Hermetic Wiper February 2022)(Citation: Symantec Ukraine Wipers February 2022)(Citation: Crowdstrike DriveSlayer February 2022)(Citation: ESET Hermetic Wiper February 2022)(Citation: Qualys Hermetic Wiper March 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Peppy
Software description: [Peppy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0643) is a Python-based remote access Trojan, active since at least 2012, with similarities to [Crimson](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0115).(Citation: Proofpoint Operation Transparent Tribe March 2016)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Clambling
Software description: [Clambling](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0660) is a modular backdoor written in C++ that has been used
